intro: Malvastrum digitatum, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its delicate, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to white, typically blooming in spring and early summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a common sight in dry, open habitats. Malvastrum digitatum is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
